alert.note: Alert for Dallam; Hartley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 20 at 7:54PM CDT until April 22 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 9 PM CDT THURSDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE WESTERN OK PANHANDLE AND THE WEST AND CENTRAL TX PANHANDLE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE WESTERN OK AND TX PANHANDLES... * Affected Area...In Oklahoma...Cimarron. In Texas...Dallam and Hartley. * 20 Foot Winds...Thursday: Southerly at 20 to 25 mph. Friday: Southerly 30 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 with isolated 70 mph. * Relative Humidity...Thursday: 8 to 15 percent. Friday: 9 to 20 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...Thursday: 3-5. Friday: 4-6. * Timing...Afternoon to early evening each day.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks. A Fire Weather Watch means that the potential for critical fire weather conditions exists. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
